details.title: Performance, life-cycle cost, and emissions of fuel cells
details.abstract: In this tutorial we evaluate the present status and future direction of fuel cell development. The three most promising types of fuel cells being evaluated for electric vehicle propulsion are: (1) direct hydrogen-consuming fuel cells; (2) methanol-consuming fuel cells; and (3) zinc-air fuel cells. The author evaluates the advantages and disadvantages of each type.
details.journal_title: IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Magazine
